result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. Sternberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 30 days in the county jail, commencing 4/2/16 @ 8am.  Huber privileges allowed.  Credit for 4 days served.  May not have contact with anyone under 18, except Deft's own children, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Comply with Sex Offender Registry.

timeConds.notes: w/Huber privileges.  Credit for 4 days served.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
30 days KCJ, comm 4/2/16 @ 8am.
no contact w/anyone under 18, except Deft's own children.  kmk

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in person with Atty Don Bielski.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  204 -   Victim rights compliance.  Minor updates made to Revocation Summary. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions. **DE is to serve 30 days as a condition of probation - to report on 4/2/16 @ 8am.** 4 days credit. Court costs ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Appeal rights, Voters rights, Firearms warning given. Any bond remaining on deposit after the payment of costs may be returned to the poster.
